item.title: Water issue, 20th January
item.description:
On grass verge outside lower end if Mulberry House,, Cleeve Hill Road, Southam GL52 3QE. Close to electricity sub station and AONB sign. Water has been pouring out for over two months. Runs down main road and into Haymes Drive. This has been treacherous ice over the last week on pavement and road. Reported to Severn Trent. Their engineer visited today and said it is not them as no main on that side of the road. He suggested it may be a spring and to report to council or highways.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Loads of pothole in such close proximity that need repairing or road resurfaced as so many there now itâ€™s like driving on a dirt track not a road !!!, 20th January
item.description:
Near to the new housing estate being build, loads of potholes & surface damage on the bends approaching the estate in both directions.- loads of craters in the road making it unavoidable not to hit one ! 1 section of awful road near pilgrive way has been resurfaced but this area has been left untouched !! Driving from Churchdown to Cheltenham & back again. This needs resurfacing as now a danger to drive on ! How highway inspections can say this road is ok is unbelievable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars driving through red light at pedestrian crossing, 20th January
item.description:
Pedestrian crossing near the Co op Hewlett Road. On Numerous occasions I have witnessed drivers not stopping at the red light. It is mostly traffic approaching the roundabout. It seems a lot of drivers donâ€™t notice the red light. This could obviously cause a tragic accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Hewlett Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road full of pot holes, 20th January
item.description:
Along side grass verge there are loads of smaller pot holes and very uneven. Pot holes in the middle of the road where cats eyes have been removed this issue is from hare and hounds up to Staverton park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Issue with Highways claiming an issue fixed., 20th January
item.description:
I have reported issues with this road twice now, and each time the Highways department has reported the problem has been fixed when it hasn't. This should be investigated as updating an issue as fixed when it isn't is surely a serious offence. Here's the issue that has just been cleared by the authorities ... NOTE - THIS ROAD PROBLEM HAS NOT BEEN FIXED. Sent to Gloucestershire County Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 5420573. Appalling potholed and damaged road surface over an extended area along the busy Priors Road from Prestbury Road all the way along to the junction with Bouncers Lane. This surface has been awful for many months after being reported. Some half-hearted attempt was made to patch some of it up - but it's now worse than ever again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 271, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Poor road markings, 20th January
item.description:
The road markings on this crossway / junction are confusing and a hazard. As I travelled along Gotherington Lane, I had to do an emergency stop as a vehicle came out to the left of me. We were both very lucky - next time we may not be so lucky! Why does the most used lane not have priority here and why is this not just a normal junction??? It is very confusing and totally in appropriate. This needs urgent attention before there is a serious accident. The chicanes that precede it also need looking at. The distance is too long and on a bend most people are ignoring the wait. Once the hedge has leaves there will be even less visibility.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Damaged x2 drain covers, iron sticking out, large hole, very dangerous to cyclists and other road users, 19th January
item.description:
Damaged x2 drain covers, iron sticking out, large hole, very dangerous to cyclists, had to avoid as I would of fallen off. Near hit from a passing car as the road is already to narrow. I cannot believe this has been left life this for 6 weeks and still not sorted. This hole is on the left after the bridge, before Windyridge turning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 404, Swindon Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
